questions.question: What was Britain's goal when it signed into order the Stamp Act?

choices.answer: To continue paying down debts from the French and Indian War.
To raise money to pay off debts for Britain's affairs in India.
To raise money to pay for the soldiers stationed in the colonies.
To raise money for the King's annual fair in London.

questions.question: What did the Stamp Act require of the colonists?

choices.answer: All printed materials had to be stamped by a British official.
All goods sold had to be stamped "Made in Britain".
Any goods sold to France had to be stamped "Made in Britain".
Colonists actually created the stamp act to tax the British.

questions.question: Why was it difficult for colonists to pay for the stamps that the Stamp Act required?

choices.answer: They only accepted flat, smooth rocks that were good for skipping.
They had to mail the money to the King.
They had to travel long distances to major cities to get stamps.
They could only pay with rare gold and silver coins.

questions.question: What young politician persuaded the House of Burgesses to pass laws to protect the colonies right to tax themselves?

choices.answer: Ben Franklin
Carlson Johannsenburger
Patrick Henry
Paul Revere

questions.question: How did colonists in Boston join Virginia and Rhode Island's efforts to ignore the Stamp Act?

choices.answer: They held a week long dance party outside of the stamper's apartment.
They damaged the home of the stamper and destroyed the governor's house.
They threw large amounts of tea in Boston Harbor.
They responded strongly in support of Britain.

questions.question: What had happened by the end of 1765?

choices.answer: All stamp distributors, except Georgia's, had resigned.
Britain repealed the Stamp Act.
The Colonists declared war on Britain.
The Declaration of Independence was mailed to the King.

questions.question: What did some of the men who led angry crowds in Boston call themselves?

choices.answer: The Sons of Washington
The Sons of Life
The Sons of Liberty
The Sons of Guns

questions.question: What consequences did the boycott led by the Sons of Liberty have on Britain?

choices.answer: Merchants in many cities agreed to stop importing British goods.
Colonists stopped using British owned city transportation.
Colonists only bought French imports.
Colonists threw cabbage at every British ship that came into their harbors.

questions.question: What major development with the Stamp Act happened in 1766?

choices.answer: The British made the Stamp Act stronger.
The British ignored the Stamp Act and didn't enforce it.
The British withdrew troops from the colonies.
The Stamp Act was repealed, or cancelled.
